questions.context_recall: What are the main types of pizza described in the document, and what are some common ingredients used to make them?
questions.context_recall_ground_truth: Neapolitan pizza has a thin, soft crust with minimal toppings, New York-style pizza has a thin, foldable crust with a crisp edge, Chicago deep-dish pizza is baked in a tall pan with layers of cheese, toppings, and chunky tomato sauce, Sicilian pizza is square and thick-crusted, California-style pizza uses creative toppings like avocado or smoked salmon, and Margherita pizza is made with tomato, mozzarella, and basil. Common ingredients include dough made from flour, water, yeast, salt, and olive oil, tomato-based sauce with herbs, mozzarella cheese, and toppings such as pepperoni, mushrooms, onions, peppers, olives, sausage, and basil, with variations like pesto, white garlic sauce, or barbecue sauce.
